description: Bidirectional index linking hypotheses to supporting documents and vice versa. Updated from comprehensive dependency audit.

referenced_in.context: Base case $35 CAC with sensitivity analysis ($30-$45 range). CAC is highest-impact variable on timeline and capital needs.
CAC <$40 assumption vs. rising Meta CPMs (27% YoY). CAC may be higher and less stable than ODD-1 assumed.
Rising CPMs compress CAC efficiency. Zero switching costs increase CAC pressure.
35% affiliate commission indicates 65%+ gross margin requirement and CAC sensitivity.
CAC variance drives capital need (±$15K per $5 CAC change).
Customer acquisition CAC <$40. Confidence: D (not validated).
Acquisition cost assumptions embedded in execution plan.
Base 50%, optimistic 60% conversion rate. Represents subscribers as % of paying customers.
Freemium model conversion benchmarks. 40-60% range for supplement subscription adoption.

referenced_in.section: Strategic Implication - Jobs to Be Done
referenced_in.context: Subscription stickiness varies by job. Job 3 (Daily Wellness) likely has highest subscription rate.
Subscription adoption 40-50%. Confidence: D (not validated).
Segment-specific subscription likelihood. Health segments show higher subscription intent.
12% monthly churn (conservative). SaaS SMB benchmarks 5-10%, supplements 8-15%.
1% churn change = ±$3K MRR at Month 18. Churn's compounding effect on trajectory.
Monthly churn <10%. Confidence: D (speculative).
Segment-specific churn risk factors. Daily Wellness job has lowest churn risk.
67% gross margin (COGS, hosting, payment processing). Conservative for SaaS, middle-of-road for supplements.
$1.79/serving with 35% affiliate commission suggests 65%+ margin achievable.
Margin compression from supplier power creates margin risk.
Marine plasma supplier concentration (3-5 qualified) constrains margin expansion.
Gross margin >60%. Confidence: C (benchmarked but not validated).
LMNT, Seaonic, Totum pricing structures. 60-70% margin range validated across competitors.
Blended LTV $106 (range $64-159). Wide range reflects churn and margin uncertainty.
LTV:CAC ratio 3.0 base case (range 1.8-5.3). Base case barely sustainable.
Chronic health segments may deliver 2-3x LTV vs. baseline. High-LTV segment identification.
LTV >$150. Confidence: D (composite of weak inputs).
Biohacker segment $180-250 LTV; Daily Wellness $120-180.
Marine plasma stickiness drives retention. Confidence: D (speculative).
10% organic lift (range 5-20%) from virality/word-of-mouth. Conservative assumption.
Strong word-of-mouth potential. Organic lift may be 15-25% IF health segment penetrated.
Marine plasma novelty drives social sharing. Confidence: D (speculative).
Base case 18 months (not 12). Original 12-month thesis NOT achievable.
Core question answered. Timeline revision required for investor communication.
ODD-1 assumes 12-month; Porter's/ICP suggest longer. 12-month contradicts structural analysis.
Seaonic took 6+ years to reach $100-180K revenue. Growth is slow without capital.
Achieve $100K MRR within 12 months. Confidence: D (contradicted by analysis).
Timeline milestones not validated against financial model.
Category creation extends timeline. Timeline depends on positioning choice (Q9).
2-3 month discovery phase delays revenue acceleration.
$75-100K total needed (staged). Original $30-50K insufficient for base case.
Staged financing strategy recommended. Go/no-go at Month 2, Month 6.
Capital tension confirmed across Porter's, ICP, market sizing analyses.
$30-50K insufficient given CPMs and category creation. Cash-flow valley = death zone.
Seaonic appears capital-constrained. Undercapitalization limits growth.
Raise $30-50K to reach $100K MRR. Confidence: D (contradicted).
Capital plan needs revision based on financial model.

IonWave/Financial_Model_Revenue_Validati.primary_purpose: Validate revenue timeline and capital requirements through comprehensive 3-scenario financial modeling
IonWave/Financial_Model_Revenue_Validati.confidence_contribution: Upgrades HYP-001 and HYP-007 from D to C; establishes HYP-003, HYP-005, HYP-006 at D

IonWave/Porter_Five_Forces_Analysis.md.primary_purpose: Analyze market structure forces and identify capital/CAC pressures from competitive dynamics
IonWave/Porter_Five_Forces_Analysis.md.confidence_contribution: Provides structural evidence for CAC inflation and capital needs; B-grade source

IonWave/ICP_Analysis.md.primary_purpose: Define ideal customer profiles, segment prioritization, and LTV potential by persona
IonWave/ICP_Analysis.md.confidence_contribution: Segment-level LTV and conversion insights; identifies Job 3 hypothesis priority

IonWave/Marine_Plasma_Market_Sizing.md.primary_purpose: Size marine plasma DTC sachet segment, estimate Seaonic revenue, validate TAM assumptions
IonWave/Marine_Plasma_Market_Sizing.md.confidence_contribution: Reframes market opportunity; validates margin assumptions; challenges timeline

tracking/Open_Questions.md.confidence_contribution: Q10 and Q11 now ANALYZED status; references hypothesis validation needs

documents.purpose: Persona dialogue challenging strategic foundation assumptions

metadata.coverage_quality: Strong - all CRITICAL hypotheses have 6-8 document references
